column4: Lack of hygiene‚Ä¶ Bedclothes are not regularly changed, bathroom was not clean, shower floods every time (I thought it was me throwing water out but it wasn‚Äôt) excellent location in Casablanca, close to most place of interest. Breakfast cost 3‚Ç¨ and it‚Äôs supposed to be served from 8:00 but the concierge was sleeping until 8:30 in the reception‚Äôs couch‚Ä¶. After he woke up and was asked about breakfast told me to wait for him to buy it in the street and bring it into the hotel‚Ä¶. üòÄ Of course I told him not to do it! If you need a place just to sleep one night and do not have booked a better option it‚Äôs ok but take in consideration that it is not a clean place at all!

I‚Äôd spent a whole day searching online for the best hotel for my money. I hit the jackpot with this place. It looks like a ‚ÄúHole-in-the-wall‚Äù from the outside, and even when first entering the lobby. But the rooms are spacious, the beds are super-comfortable, the staff is warm and friendly, and the breakfast is more than adequate. They people at the counter are anxious to help you find your way to wherever you want to go. For the money, you cant go wrong. I‚Äôll stay here when I return to Casablanca!

The price is reasonable with convenient location. You can reach the tram station in 5 minutes and take the tram to ONCF station Casa Voyageurs within 20 minutes. Room is tidy and clean. Staff are great, nice, honest and helpful, and they taught us how to go to Hassan II Mosque and station patiently and easily.

column3: Wonderful hotel in Casablanca, Hotel point du jour Casablanca city Morocco. I recommend you to stay here üòäüòä
column4: All it's perfect In Hotel point du jour Casablanca Morocco. Thank so Much Mr Jalal receptionist And Mr Redouane manager of the hotel. They was Amazing Guys i appreciate your service and all things also Informations about places in Casablanca to visit. Can go by walking Don't need transportation because old Medina just 10 munites walk.Hassan 2 Mosque 25 munites walk and Places Mohammed five 3 minutes walk, place United States . Taramway near . Restaurants, shopping. TWIN CENTER Best regards!

I spent my first day in Morocco at this wonderful hotel, and I can tell you its an ideal place to get over serious jetlag! I messaged the staff to ask for an early check in, and they were kind enough to oblige. Hotel staff also kept in touch with me throughout my journey to Morocco, answering any questions that come up. My husband and I were able to get a decent rest in our tidy room before we did a little sightseeing. Jalal was incredibly helpful - he gave good recommendations and good directions! The staff at this hotel really know how to make a guest feel welcome and comfortable. Thank you, Hotel Point du Jour.

This hotel was clean, comfortable, and well-kept, but the review is primarily for the staff. My sister had a dental emergency during our visit, and the concierge went out of his way to help us find a dentist, a pharmacy, and ice to help her pain. He spent over an hour helping us and checked in any time another member of the party left the hotel. We appreciated his help so much during a stressful time. Thank you!!

column3: Nice little hotel in the very center of town
column4: Nice little hotel in the very center of town ‚Äì next to tram. Good breakfast and good information from helpful reception team. Rooms are small and facility could use uplift, but overall good value for money.

This hotel in Casablanca has gone above and beyond our expectations. They have been EXTREMELY friendly and helpful with any questions we have had in regards to exploring the country of Morocco. The customer service is exceptional and they have done what they can in their power to make us feel comfortable and welcome. I would definitely stay here again thanks to Redoune and Sied. In addition, breakfast is offered in the morning for an extremely reasonable price! I would recommend staying here to anyone!

our room was quite big and very clean, the bed very comfortable, and the service excellent. the people there made us very welcome, they were also very helpful , always with a smile. This hotel is walking distance to the Place de la liberation with all the cafes and restaurants, and of course the old Medina ( highly recommended) , but if you're not afraid of walking a bit further,like an extra 15 minutes I also recommend in the morning the fishing port with the fish market and the fishing boats. lots of great photos to take there.

This 2-star hotel is really value for money. It is modern, clean and comfortable. The service was impeccable. That's what sets them apart from many other hotels. The Wi-fi in the room is weak though. It is near a tram station, some nice small eateries and coffee places.

Awesome all around. During my visit i was Sick and they brought me hot lemon juice and kept in touch with me making sure I was ok. Even offered to call Me a doctor. The place is clean and all staff was friendly and supportive. Centrally located. We walked everywhere. Yes it has older towels but they are clean and freshened daily. Rooms are small to some standards but I was actually pleasantly surprised how big they were to what I expected. Sitting area included in your room. Large dining area to enjoy all day. I would come back here for sure if I ever came back to Casablanca. I have no problem recommending.

column3: Great hotel with the best staff
column4: My friend and I stayed here 3 nights and the staff were wonderful. They went above and beyond running out to get lemons and make hot lemon tea for my friend who had caught a cold. Very central, easy walk to the Mosque, Palace and Mohammed V Place. Clean and great breakfast in the morning for a small charge. Highly recommend this hotel for the price.

This little place was amazing. Staff are so welcoming, rooms are spotless, water was hot, wifi was good. We arrived as group of 6 after 22 hours of flying. Were greeted with a smile, given great recommendation for dinner. When we got lost walking to the restaurant, we called hotel and he came met us in the street and walked us to the restaurant. Breakfast was yummy and value for money. Such a great find and would definitely stay again.

This hotel epitomises the phrase 'cheap and cheerful.' But it's really all about the great staff. Given it's only 2 stars, this isn't a hotel for fine linens and silver service. Or strong water pressure, for that matter. But for a short stay, it's a great place to get your bearings. Which the staff will gladly help you with. Clean rooms, a lift, a TV... it's all you could want for the price.

Nice Place clean quiet and nice discreet staff , It's right in the centre near both Train stations the United Nations Square and the Medina recently restored It gets an 8 +. One of the nicer places we stayed in here in Morocco, after all the Riads this was almost Heaven üòÇ

I could not have made a better choice. This hotel is very centrally located. It is close to shops, restaurants, public transit, and major tourist attractions such as Mohammad V Square. The staff were very friendly, professional, and went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. I spent a total of six nights at Hotel Point du Jour and would highly recommend to anyone visiting Casablanca. This will definitely be my home away from home during any future visit to that city.

The room is nice. Nothing fancy, but sufficient (byo shampoo and conditioner) The staff is lovely and helpful, especially Ali. The location is good, there are few good restaurants around and it's safe.

My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Room was quite nice, very quiet and clean. Water pressure in the shower was not great, Wi-Fi was extremely slow, almost useless. Room got really stuffy even though the air conditioning was on, until we figured out how to open the window. Close enough to walk to the Hassan Mosque. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Traveller Tip - cafes usually only drinks, maybe pastries. For an actual meal you need to go to a restaurant or brassiere

column3: Lovely staff, clean room and nice location
column4: The staff were very friendly and always willing to help. The location is just in the center, can walk to some sightseeing spot and restaurant. The taxi in casablenca was like hell to us, we need to negotiate so many time in order to get into hotel... So walking is good!! Just for the reference, the taxi we paid from CTM bus station is 40MAD. To mosque is 20MAD. To airport (hotel arranged) is 300 MAD. The room us very clean, big and the bed is comfy. They do have elevator and their staff were all friendly and amazing. Thank you!

This hotel is really well located. They have an elevator, which made me really happy. Staff was really nice. Room is small but clean, air condition works well. They don‚Äôt have a safe box, I wish they did. The shower was terrible and I had trouble woth the toilet. I was disappointed that they didn‚Äôt change towels, refresh, clean or make the room during your stay. Other then that, it‚Äôs a decent 2 stars hotel.

column3: Good Value, Helpful Staff, Close to City Centre
column4: This is a 2 star hotel. Our family booked 3 rooms. The staff were very accommodating. The beds and linen clean. The water pressure and temperature were fine. Internet connection was also fine, never dropped out, albeit a bit slow but normal for Moroccan standards. The location very central to the centre of Casablanca. Breakfast is offered, i would recommend trying breakfast in a local cafe around the corner.

column3: Great hotel for a short stay
column4: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night before flying out from Casablanca. The staff was super friendly! The hotel is small but we found it to be clean and centrally located. Would definitely recommend for a stay in Casablanca.

Stayed 6 nights and were treated as one of the family. Only 2 star but with 5 star service, excellent value for money and a great location, very quiet. Manager and ALL staff were more than happy to help in any way, advised on great places to eat with local/traditional food, arranged transport, etc. Would most definitely stay again and highly recommend.

I was stay here 1 night .easy to find . Very clean room . good location . Reception very friendly . Good price too.easy go to old medina. Palace mohamed. Safe place . Breakfast so good . Quiet at night easy sleep

The hotel is nothing to talk about, but the staff was extremely helpful and nice to us. They wend out of the way to show us restaurants and exchange options. Location is good, but the rooms are very basic, no safe/hairdryer/coffee maker etc. Could only get coffee after 7.30 in the morning.

We visited Casablanca twice during our trip to Morocco and stayed at Hotel Point du Jour each time. The staff were truly fantastic, especially Jalal and Redouane, and would go out of their way to make sure we were having an excellent stay. They were also very helpful in pointing out places to visit and providing directions or advice on how to get there. The location is excellent - only a few minutes walk away from many of the main attractions of Casablanca while also on a quiet street with very little traffic noise. The rooms were also spotless and well set out. Make sure you stay here when you visit Casablanca!

I'm an expat currently working in Morocco. Even there are some great 5 star hotels in Casablanca, when it comes to midrange hotel which is appropriate both for business and leisure it's very difficult to find a good one (this happens in other cities in Morocco, most of budget hotels are old and not well maintained). So this hotel is the best choice for travelers who don't need a luxury hotel but need good service and cleanliness to rest. Why I recommend this hotel: Casa port station is walking distance. 1 min walk from tramway station. Located in central area. Quiet and safe area (in weekend bars and restaurants around make some noise but till 0 a.m.) Cleanliness. Shower works well. Beds are comfortable. Decor and lighting are simple and chic. Good amenities for this price. ‚Ä¶

I could go on and on, but suffice it to say the POINT DU JOUR Hotel was Central, very clean, and well run. The staff was ready to answer any question, give all kinds of help. On our first day in town, one of the staff actually WALKED US DOWN to his favorite restaurant ( four blocks away ) , so as to make sure we didn't get lost. That is something I consider beyond the call of duty.

column3: Small Hotel and Good location Value for money
column4: Noisy at night due to a bar or disco nearby. Small hotel in good location, 2mins walk to Tramway. Rapid check in &out. Staff are welcoming. Room is clean and comfortable bed. Special thanks to Manager Mr. Redouane, Mr Jalal and Samira for their warm welcome. I highly recommend this hotel and will return back next holiday to Casablanca.

column3: If you say you'd stay there again, it must be nice.
column4: This hotel is a great find. It's small. The owner and staff friendly and helpful. Clean, comfortable, and simple. The hot water is hot, the bed is comfortable, and the internet works. The breakfast is okay for the money, and the neighborhood is perfect for getting to know your way around this amazing city by foot...don't want to walk? The Tram is a short block away and will take you for 80 cents to the two main train stations or to the beach...a nice trip through the city's outskirts.

column3: Good Value, Helpful Staff, Close to City Centre
column4: This is a 2 star hotel. Our family booked 3 rooms. The staff were very accommodating. The beds and linen clean. The water pressure and temperature were fine. Internet connection was also fine, never dropped out, albeit a bit slow but normal for Moroccan standards. The location very central to the centre of Casablanca. Breakfast is offered, i would recommend trying breakfast in a local cafe around the corner.

column3: Great hotel for a short stay
column4: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night before flying out from Casablanca. The staff was super friendly! The hotel is small but we found it to be clean and centrally located. Would definitely recommend for a stay in Casablanca.

Stayed 6 nights and were treated as one of the family. Only 2 star but with 5 star service, excellent value for money and a great location, very quiet. Manager and ALL staff were more than happy to help in any way, advised on great places to eat with local/traditional food, arranged transport, etc. Would most definitely stay again and highly recommend.

I was stay here 1 night .easy to find . Very clean room . good location . Reception very friendly . Good price too.easy go to old medina. Palace mohamed. Safe place . Breakfast so good . Quiet at night easy sleep

The hotel is nothing to talk about, but the staff was extremely helpful and nice to us. They wend out of the way to show us restaurants and exchange options. Location is good, but the rooms are very basic, no safe/hairdryer/coffee maker etc. Could only get coffee after 7.30 in the morning.
